More Half-Life, more of the same. I would call the first Half-Life game near perfect, but something about the 2s has been off for me, always being ALMOST fun. Maybe its because they've been opened up a bit, or time has moved on, but I don't love these sequels. Episodes One and Two make for a pretty good game, neither one being that much better than the other. I recommend because it's a great shooter and at this point, you're probably invested. 
But maybe no Half-Life 3 isn't the worst fate in the world?

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Half-Life 2: Episode Two is the second DLC game in the Episodic Half-Life 2 Franchise. It's set in the woodland kilometers away from City 17 and you have to reunite with your old pals that you met in Half-Life 2.

[h1]Gameplay and Level Design[/h1]
The Gameplay in Half-Life 2: Episode Two is amazing, it's paced remarkably well. The expansion pack includes nimble puzzles which are fun in retrospect. Midway through the game, you get a car and the games turns into a sandbox game with the sore goal to survive.

The level design in the 2nd expansion is incredible. It has everything, from caves, valleys, forests, abandoned towns, and etcetera. The levels are very replayable, fun and very amusing. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics in Episode Two are great, some assets are re-used from older titles but most of them have been updated into a woodland look, which really goes well with the barren wasteland you're thrown in. The caves at the beginning of the game are like some tech demo from 2010 to relay the futuristic reflective tool.

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1] 
As with all Half-Life titles, this title has an amazing soundtrack, they have this metallic vibe and it fits with the game because most of the time you're battling aliens and The Combine. My favourite track from the OST is Vortal Combat. I like the fast, and action-paced tempo with the electric guitar doing wonders.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RZRNd6osQrk

[h1]Achievements[/h1] 
As of today, I have completed [b]all achievements from the Half-Life: Episodic franchise.[/b] This was one of the reasons why I kept coming back to these older titles. I would like to say that I'm a die-hard Half-Life fan and these achievements are in my way of proving my worth. My favourite achievement being Little Rocket Man, in which you have to carry a gnome through 5/6 of the game.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1] 
In Conclusion, I would say that Half-Life 2: Episode Two is one of or not my favourite games I've ever played, it's so unique with its environments. It has enough content to be a stand-alone Half-Life game. If I had to rate this game, I would [i][without hesitation][/i] rate it a 10 out of 10. One of the all-time greats. Thanks for reading and have a great day.

从02年第一次接触Half-life，我就深深地爱上了这款游戏了，游戏剧情紧紧相扣，我爱它的剧情，但其更值得表扬的是，它不仅是个射击类游戏，玩家通过每个关卡都需要动脑筋去思考。half-life2 第二章虽然他的章节并不多，我完了3小时就通关了，但是整体来说，很流畅，也具有挑战性，希望3快点出吧，作为half-life老玩家我迫不及待想知道后面发生的剧情，命途多舛的戈登弗里曼，到底优惠彭带什么样的困难与挑战呢？

[spoiler]（半条命无疑是经典中的经典）[/spoiler]
我是一个从HL2玩到第二章的人，玩这个系列的游戏不由自主想全成就
以下是我的心得：
成就方面难度不是太大，唯一一个我觉得有点难的是邻近区域监视——三角机甲和捕食者的搭配
真的很恶心[spoiler]其实主要是我前面几章火箭筒、能量弹用的太嗨用光了弹药不够只能下一次
重来....[/spoiler]当然最后还是尝试了几次过了...心满意足得到全成就。
还有一个花园侏儒我找了半天结果玩完才发现在前面Alex通讯时的桌子下面，然后就是开车那段
很麻烦[spoiler]我擦，你别掉下去啊....[/spoiler]
总之，期待半条命3，虽然G胖不数三[spoiler]Alex都患上忧郁症了好吗[/spoiler]

The world falls apart around you and Alyx as one chaotic battle leads to another in this exciting chapter of the Half-Life series! The most difficult chapter, in my opinion, with an intense story line that begs to be completed in the sacred and long awaited third enstallment of this game series!

Once again I reccomend this game to almost everyone, but I warn you. Once you play this game, you will join the many people who wait in earnest for the conclusion. The riviting story and relatable characters will leave you wanting more!

To this day, I have never hated a villain more than I hate the Combine after playing this game. Gabe, [spoiler] I want revenge on those worms for killing him. [/spoiler] My crowbar is ready!

La secuela, de la secuela, eso es Half Life 2: Episode Two.
¿Y eso es malo? pues no, el juego es increíble, mas allá de su corta duración, es uno de mis favoritos, nuevos enemigos, buena dificultad, momentos críticos y que te dejarán el corazón en blanco, gran banda sonora, combates inolvidables, y escenarios muy buenos para su época, lo recomiendo, especialmente si eres un fan de Half Life y vienes en busca de rejugar el juego o terminar la saga.

Eso sí, al terminar este juego te quedará un vacío en el corazón que no podrás quitar, prepárate para consecuencias imprevistas...

9/10
It'll be 10 years since this game released alongside Portal 1 and Team Fortress 2 in October. I don't want to die without having played Half-Life 3 in my life, but it's looking to turn out that way.

Episode 2 is an amazing addition to Half-Life 2. It is around 2 hours longer than episode one and is definitely a step up. It adds new areas, a new enemy type and the general level design makes for some very interesting gameplay.

From the turret defence in the mines to the silo attack at the end the pacing is full throttle from start to finish, to an extent we never saw in the base game. The 6 hour length is a decent step up from Ep.1 and it is filled with so many awesome moments that I think it rivals even the base game. 9/10

Когда-нибудь Гейб поднимит свою жирную задницу с горы денег, нагребённые с CS:GO, Dota 2 и даст нам, простым смертным продолжение истории о молчиливым физике-теоретике Гордоне Фримане. Half-Life 2: Episode 3, и мы узнаем как закончится эта история...

Half Life 2 episode 2 is a good game. It is just as good as Half Life 2 and hl2 episode 1. It improves on a few things, like the flashlight being tied to sprinting is now fixed. Probably among other things, cannot remember those off the top of my head.


But, the one problem with this game...

THEY ACTUALLY END THE GAME ON A CLIFFHANGER.
IMPLYING THERE WILL BE A SEQUEL.
AND IT'S BEEN LITERALLY 9 OR SO YEARS.

I know Valve doesn't even need to make games anymore to have boatloads of money because they make money off of hosting other people's games, but could you at least give people a deadline to make another game? Heck, give them a few years to make the game and get even more rich than you already are. Just give the devs a deadline to give them a reason not to scrap every version they come up with.

Heck, make a contest and give 4 well selected mod teams the story to HL2e3 and have them attempt to make parts of what could be HL2e3. Then, give some stuff to the first place winner and stitch together the mods and apply some of your own work and you've got the HL2e3 that everyone wants. Just give us HL2e3. I'm tired of people making jokes about HL3 confirmed.

Po ukończnieu Ep2 można łatwo znaleźć odpowiedź na pytanie, dlaczego nie powstał Ep3? Dlatego, że trudno byłoby przebić Ep2 ;) Nie bójmy się słów, w drugim epizodzie Valve przeszło samo siebie tworząc coś tak kapitalnego. Nowi przeciwnicy, więcej G-mana, pojawienie się wielu ciekawych wątków fabularnych oraz epickie zakończenie, czego fani serii mogli chceć więcej? Valve spełniło marzenia wielu fanów wypuszczając Ep2. Niestety po ukończeniu tak rewelacyjnej gry oprócz oczywistego uczucia zadowolenia pojawia się też uczucie lekkiego smutu związane z tym, że jest to niezmiennie od wielu lat ostatnia część serii. Wszyscy fani serii oraz miłośnicy po prostu porządnych gier powinni zaopatrzyć się w duży zapas cierpliwości i czekać cierpliwie na kolejną grę z serii Half-Life bo ta kiedyś zapewne powstanie.
Still creeps the shit out of me
